void my_strcpy ( char  destination[],
char  source[],
int  destination_length 
)

Safe form of string copy.

my_strcpy() copies one string into another but does a size check before that.

Parameters:
[out] destination string copied to
[in] source string copied from
[in] destination_length length of destination buffer
Returns:
nothing
See also:
Discussion of strncpy: http://www.inspirel.com/articles/Strncpy_And_Safety.html
You cannot use sizeof here. See: CERT

Definition at line 42 of file global_tools.c.

{
    if ( (int) strlen(source) <= destination_length ) {
        strcpy( destination, source );
    }
    else {
        fprintf( stderr, "Cannot copy destination string into source string\n");
        exit(1);
    }

    return;
}

void str_toupper ( char  string[]  ) 

Converts a given string into upper case.

Converts a given string into upper case. The string is converted inplace. No copying is being done.

Parameters:
[in] string a given string
Returns:
nothing
See also:
[n/a]

Definition at line 17 of file global_tools.c.

{
    int i;
    int str_length = (int) strlen(string);

    for ( i = 0; i < str_length; i++ ) {
        string[i] = toupper( string[i] );
    }

    return;
}
